what: Import data from the BITRE website into R
title: Getting Started
code: library(ozroaddeaths) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(lubridate) #library(ggridges) crashes <- oz_road_fatal_crash()  fatalities <- oz_road_fatalities()

title: Getting Started
code: knitr::kable(head(crashes))

title: Getting Started
code: knitr::kable(head(fatalities))

title: Getting Started
code: crash_plot <- ggplot(crashes,                      aes(x = year)) +   geom_line(stat = "count") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Annual number of fatal car accidents per year")  crash_plot

what: Plot crashes by year and state
title: Getting Started
code: crash_plot +   scale_y_continuous(trans = "log2") +   facet_wrap(~state) +    labs(title = "Annual number of fatal car accidents per year and state",         subtitle = "log2 scale" )

title: Getting Started
code: fatality_plot <- fatalities %>%   mutate(year = lubridate::year(date_time)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x =  year)) +   geom_line(stat = "count") +   theme_minimal() +   ggtitle("Annual number of road fatalities")  fatality_plot fatality_plot <- fatalities %>%   filter(gender != "Unspecified") %>%   mutate(year = lubridate::year(date_time)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = age,               fill = gender )) +   geom_density() +   facet_wrap(~gender) +   theme_minimal() +   ggtitle("Distribution of road fatalities by age 1989 to 2024")  fatality_plot ## Warning: Removed 98 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range ## (`stat_density()`). ## Warning: Groups with fewer than two data points have been dropped. ## Warning in max(ids, na.rm = TRUE): no non-missing arguments to max; returning ## -Inf

what: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
title: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
text: ozroaddeaths package pulls data Australian Road Deaths Database, run Bureau Infrastructure, Transport Regional Economics (BITRE). provides basic details road transport crash fatalities Australia reported police month State Territory road safety authorities. details provided database fall two groups: circumstances crash, example, date, location, crash type details regarding persons killed, example, age, gender road user group.

title: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
text: can install ozroaddeaths github : R Universe : data taken Australian Road Deaths Database, provides basic details road transport crash fatalities Australia reported police month State Territory road safety authorities, obtained : https://data.gov.au/dataset/ds-dga-5b530fb8-526e-4fbf-b0f6-aa24e84e4277/details?q=crash Details provided database fall two groups: circumstances crash, example, date, location, crash type details regarding persons killed, example, age, gender road user group. fatality data updated every month. heavy vehicle flags (articulated truck, heavy rigid truck bus involvement) updated quarter, current within two months. Information heavy rigid truck involvement crashes earlier 2004 incomplete. day month data, imputed first month.
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("njtierney/ozroaddeaths") install.packages("ozroaddeaths", repos = c("https://njtierney.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

what: Import data from the BITRE website into R
title: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
code: library(ozroaddeaths) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(lubridate) library(ggridges) crashes <- oz_road_fatal_crash()  fatalities <- oz_road_fatalities()

title: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
code: knitr::kable(dplyr::as_data_frame(names(crashes))) #> Warning: `as_data_frame()` was deprecated in tibble 2.0.0. #> ℹ Please use `as_tibble()` (with slightly different semantics) to convert to a #>   tibble, or `as.data.frame()` to convert to a data frame. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. knitr::kable(head(crashes))

title: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
code: knitr::kable(dplyr::as_data_frame(names(fatalities))) knitr::kable(head(fatalities))

title: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
code: crash_plot <- ggplot(crashes,                      aes(x = year,                          fill = year)) +   geom_line(stat = "count") +   theme_minimal() +   ggtitle("Annual number of fatal car accidents per year")  crash_plot #> Warning: The following aesthetics were dropped during statistical transformation: fill. #> ℹ This can happen when ggplot fails to infer the correct grouping structure in #>   the data. #> ℹ Did you forget to specify a `group` aesthetic or to convert a numerical #>   variable into a factor?

title: Pulls Data From Australian Road Deaths Database
code: fatality_plot <- fatalities %>%   mutate(year = lubridate::year(date_time)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x =  year,               fill = year)) +   geom_line(stat = "count") +   theme_minimal() +   ggtitle("Annual number of road fatalities")  fatality_plot #> Warning: The following aesthetics were dropped during statistical transformation: fill. #> ℹ This can happen when ggplot fails to infer the correct grouping structure in #>   the data. #> ℹ Did you forget to specify a `group` aesthetic or to convert a numerical #>   variable into a factor? fatality_plot <- fatalities %>%   filter(gender != "Unspecified") %>%   mutate(year = lubridate::year(date_time)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = age,               fill = gender )) +   geom_density() +   facet_wrap(~gender) +   theme_minimal() +   ggtitle("Distribution of road fatalities by age 1989 to 2017")  fatality_plot #> Warning: Removed 98 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density()`). #> Warning: Groups with fewer than two data points have been dropped. #> Warning in max(ids, na.rm = TRUE): no non-missing arguments to max; returning #> -Inf

what: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
text: function pulls data Australian Road Deaths Database,     specifically, circumstances crash, example, date,     location, crash type.

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
code: oz_road_fatal_crash(source = "stable")

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
text: https://bitre.gov.au/statistics/safety/fatal_road_crash_database.aspx

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
text: source Character. Either "stable" "latest".

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
text: dataset (tibble) fatal crash data Format: data frame 43,345 observations following 14 variables. `crash_id` integer, 13 digits, unique crash `state` Text, Austraian jurisdiction, Abbreviation state territory. QLD = Queensland, NSW = New South Wales, ACT = Australian Capital Territory, VIC = Victoria, TAS = TASMANIA, SA = South Australia, WA = Western Australian, NT = Northern Territory `date` Date, Year, Month. date crash, unknown date (set 1st) `month` Integer, month date crash `year` Integer, year date crash `weekday` Text weekday date crash `time` Time, time date crash `date_time` POSIXct, date time crash `n_fatalities` Integer, number killed persons crash `crash_type` Character, Code summarising type type crash. Single, Multiple, Pedestrian `bus` logical - whether bus involved crash (TRUE) (FALSE) `heavy_rigid_truck` logical - whether heavy rigid truck involved crash (TRUE) (FALSE) `articualated_truck` logical - whether articulated trucl involved crash (TRUE) (FALSE) `speed_limit` Integer, posted speed limit location crash

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
text: two sources data: data.gov.au bitre.gov.au. bitre.gov.au --date, inconsistencies two sources certain crash records.

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatal_crash
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ oz_road_fatal_crash } # }

what: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatalities
title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatalities
text: function pulls data Australian Road Deaths Database.     Specifically, details regarding persons killed,     example, age, gender road user group.

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatalities
code: oz_road_fatalities(source = "stable")

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatalities
text: source Character. Either "stable" "latest".

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatalities
text: dataset (tibble) fatal crash data `crash_id` integer, 13 digits, unique crash `state` Text, Austraian jurisdiction, Abbreviation state territory. QLD = Queensland, NSW = New South Wales, ACT = Australian Capital Territory, VIC = Victoria, TAS = TASMANIA, SA = South Australia, WA = Western Australian, NT = Northern Territory `date` Date, Year, Month Day. date crash, unknown day set 1st `month` Integer, month date crash `year` Integer, year date crash `weekday` Text weekday date crash `time` Time, time date crash `crash_type` Character, Code summarising type type crash. Single, Multiple, Pedestrian `date_time` POSIXct, date time crash `bus` logical - whether bus involved crash (TRUE) (FALSE) `heavy_rigid_truck` logical - whether heavy rigid truck involved crash (TRUE) (FALSE) `articualated_truck` logical - whether articulated trucl involved crash (TRUE) (FALSE) `speed_limit` Integer, posted speed limit location crash `road_user` Text, Type person killed. Driver, Passenger, Pedestrian, Motorcycle Rider, Motorcycle Passenger, Bicyclist (including pillion passengers) `gender` Text, Biological Sex person killed, Male, Female, Unknown `age` Integer, Age person killed, years

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatalities
text: two sources data: data.gov.au bitre.gov.au. bitre.gov.au --date, inconsistencies two sources certain crash records.

title: Retrieve Australian Fatal Crash Data — oz_road_fatalities
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ oz_road_fatalities } # }

title: ozroaddeaths — ozroaddeaths
text: ozroaddeaths package pulls data Australian Road Deaths     Database, run Bureau Infrastructure, Transport Regional     Economics (BITRE). provides basic details road transport crash     fatalities Australia reported police month State     Territory road safety authorities. details provided     database fall two groups: 1) circumstances crash,     example, date, location, crash type details regarding persons     killed, example, age, gender road user group.
